title: How to Determine Whether a Puppy Is Male or Female

steps.title: Feel below the puppy’s belly button for a raised spot.
steps.content: Feel below the puppy’s belly button for a raised spot. Just like you, a dog has a belly button—it’s usually located almost at the center of the belly, just below the rib cage. [1] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source If your puppy is male, there will be another small raised spot or “button” of flesh about an inch or so below their belly button. This is the prepuce, or sheath, of the puppy’s penis. [2] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source The prepuce also has a small hole at the center. There may be little wispy hairs around or in the prepuce. The belly button or umbilicus forms from the scar left behind after the umbilical cord falls off. If the puppy was born within the last few days, the umbilical cord may still be attached. Once the umbilical cord shrivels and falls off (which happens within a few days), there will be a little, slightly thicker scar left behind on the belly. Warning: Do not attempt to pull out or unsheathe a male puppy’s penis until the puppy is at least 6 months old. Dogs have an os penis or “penis bone.” You may damage the penis or penis bone if you attempt to forcibly unsheathe a young male dog’s penis.

steps.title: Feel if the puppy’s belly is smooth.
steps.content: Feel if the puppy’s belly is smooth. Unlike male puppies, female puppies have smooth bellies (other than their umbilicus scar). Females do not have a prepuce or a raised bump below their belly button. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Examine the puppy’s rear end for a fleshy mound.
steps.content: Examine the puppy’s rear end for a fleshy mound. A puppy’s anus is located directly under its tail. If your puppy is male, you will only be able to see its anus. If your puppy is female, you will see a raised, fleshy area just under the anus. This is the vulva. [4] X Research source The vulva of a female puppy is small and leaf-shaped. It has a vertical slit. It is usually located almost directly between the puppy’s hind legs. The vulva may have some wispy hairs on it.

steps.title: Check for testicles if the puppy is 8 weeks old.
steps.content: Check for testicles if the puppy is 8 weeks old. Male puppies will have testicles, although you may not be able to feel or see them before they are 8 weeks old. [5] X Research source If the puppy is 8 weeks or older, the testicles can be seen high up between the puppy’s hind legs. [6] X Research source When a male puppy is born, his testicles are inside his body. After 2 weeks, the testicles start to drop into the scrotum. Both testicles typically drop within 6 months. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Disregard that the puppy has nipples.
steps.content: Disregard that the puppy has nipples. Like humans and other mammals, both male and female dogs have nipples. These small bumps extend from the groin to the stomach and do not determine the sex of your puppy. [8] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source The number of nipples varies per puppy. Dogs typically have between 8 and 10 nipples.

steps.title: Consult your veterinarian.
steps.content: Consult your veterinarian. Puppies should have their first set of vaccinations at around 6 weeks old. If you can’t figure out what sex your puppy is, your veterinarian can help you with this during a routine visit. [9] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source If you’re a breeder, you’ll typically want the puppy to see a vet within 3 days of being born for contractual purposes. [10] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source A puppy’s first visit includes a weigh-in, body examination, and feces examination.

steps.title: Pick up the puppy gently.
steps.content: Pick up the puppy gently. Newborn and young puppies are very delicate, so make sure to handle them with care. Puppies can’t see or hear very well before they’re a few weeks old, so picking them up and holding them may make them nervous or fussy. So, when you do have to pick them up, do so gently and slowly. [11] X Research source Never pick up a puppy by its tail. Slide your hand under as much of the body as possible to offer the best support as you pick up the puppy. Handle puppies as little as possible during their first 2 weeks after birth. Over-handling them could upset the mother dog or harm the puppies. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Hold the puppy in cupped hands.
steps.content: Hold the puppy in cupped hands. Lay the puppy in your hands on its back, with its paws in the air. Support the puppy’s whole body with your hands so you don’t stress their spine. Make sure not to squeeze the puppy. [13] X Research source When trying to determine the sex, it may be easier if someone else holds the puppy so you can do the visual inspection. You can also rest them on their backs on a warm towel spread on a table. This can help keep the puppy warm.

steps.title: Work quickly when handling puppies.
steps.content: Work quickly when handling puppies. Newborn puppies cannot maintain their own body temperature for several weeks after they’re born and can get chilled very easily. [14] X Trustworthy Source Best Friends Animal Society Nonprofit animal welfare organization dedicated to saving animal lives by operating and supporting no-kill animal shelters Go to source Aim to only hold the puppy for 5 to 10 minutes before returning them to their mother or warm bed. [15] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Use a heating pad or hot water bottle wrapped in a towel in the puppy’s bed to help keep it warm.

steps.title: Notice if the puppy squirms.
steps.content: Notice if the puppy squirms. If the puppy shows signs of distress, such as squalling or squirming, put the puppy back with its mother or in their bedding immediately. [16] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source As a general rule, it’s better to handle newborn puppies as little as possible. The mother may also become distressed if she isn’t used to you handling her pups. If you notice signs of her getting distressed, such as barking at you, put the puppy back with the mother. Contact your veterinarian if you’re concerned about the puppy (or their mother) for further guidance.

steps.title: The best dog for you is one that matches your and your family’s wants and needs.
steps.content: The best dog for you is one that matches your and your family’s wants and needs. At the end of the day, pick a dog that best fits your lifestyle based on temperament, energy levels, and physicality. Female and male dogs have many similarities, but they can also differ in size and personality. For instance, female dogs tend to be more sociable and smaller in size, while males are more protective and larger in size. Here are the leading differences between a boy and girl dog: [17] X Research source Male dogs have testosterone, which can cause roaming, mounting, and urine marking. Female dogs have ovaries and produce estrogen and progesterone, which can lead to heat cycles or vaginal bleeding (unless spayed). Males tend to be larger in size and weight when compared to females. Females tend to be more social, while males prefer alone time. Females are considered more trainable when compared to males. [18] X Research source Keep in mind that a dog’s breed, environment, and upbringing can play a big part in their personality and overall temperament.

steps.title: At what age can you tell the sex of a puppy?
steps.content: At what age can you tell the sex of a puppy? You can typically tell the sex of a puppy once they’re 3 to 4 weeks old. It’s also important to wait this long before sexing the puppy because it gives the puppies time to develop. [19] X Research source

steps.title: What determines the sex of a dog?
steps.content: What determines the sex of a dog? The sex of a dog comes down to one thing: genetics. A dog’s sex is determined by their chromosomes (two strands that make up DNA. Every dog has two sex chromosomes—females having two X chromosomes and males having one X and one Y. [20] X Research source The father’s genetics determine the sex of a puppy, while the mother’s genetics determine the size of the litter. [21] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source In recent years, breeders have experimented with the possibility of predetermining the sex of puppies in a litter by playing with the pH levels of the mother’s vagina. [22] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source

steps.title: How do you differentiate between a girl and a boy dog?
steps.content: How do you differentiate between a girl and a boy dog? Girl dogs have a flat belly with no raised bump below the belly button and a vulva opening near the anus. Boy dogs have a raised bump beneath the belly button and a scrotum between the hind legs (that becomes visible after 8 weeks). [23] X Research source
